definition: a large piece of fabric (usually canvas fabric) by means of which wind is used to propel a sailing vessel, cover with a sheet, as if by wrapping
details:
noun
- a large piece of fabric (usually canvas fabric) by means of which wind is used to propel a sailing vessel
= synonyms: sail
- bed linen consisting of a large rectangular piece of cotton or linen cloth
= synonyms: bed sheet
- (nautical) a line (rope or chain) that regulates the angle at which a sail is set in relation to the wind
= synonyms: tack
- a flat artifact that is thin relative to its length and width
= synonyms: flat solid
- paper used for writing or printing
= synonyms: piece of paper, sheet of paper
- newspaper with half-size pages
= synonyms: rag
- any broad thin expanse or surface
= example: any broad thin expanse or surface
- (mathematics) an unbounded two-dimensional shape
= synonyms: plane
verb
- cover with a sheet, as if by wrapping
= example: cover with a sheet, as if by wrapping
- come down as if in sheets
= example: come down as if in sheets
